fields.description:
On VPC setup, I have 2 NCs which shows the same problem. Initially it works fine. I could run instances and attach ENIs. Then both NCs start to fail to run instances.  When eucalyptus-nc is restarted, the problem disappears. 

NC.log has these lines:

2016-03-24 14:47:31  WARN | invocation 'blkid /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work/AIDAAU4Q7BJRWSGNXMMB6/i-29c45762/link-to-vda' failed with -1 (attempt 1)
2016-03-24 14:47:31  WARN | invocation 'blkid /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work/AIDAAU4Q7BJRWSGNXMMB6/i-29c45762/link-to-vda' failed with -1 (attempt 2)
2016-03-24 14:47:31  WARN | invocation 'blkid /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work/AIDAAU4Q7BJRWSGNXMMB6/i-29c45762/link-to-vda' failed with -1 (attempt 3)
2016-03-24 14:47:34  WARN | secgroup sg-8997c75f: no instances
2016-03-24 14:47:34  INFO | gni populated in 5.59 ms.
2016-03-24 14:47:37 ERROR | failed to fork to check hypervisor connection
2016-03-24 14:47:39  WARN | failed to invoke getstats for sensor data (Cannot allocate memory)
2016-03-24 14:47:39  WARN | failed to invoke getstats for sensor data
2016-03-24 14:47:39  WARN | secgroup sg-8997c75f: no instances
2016-03-24 14:47:39  INFO | gni populated in 5.84 ms.

comments.body:
There is a memory/resource leak here, restarting the NC service should allow it to reset while the source is tracked down.

service eucalyptus-nc restart
[~jbreiding] [~swathi] I have a QA setup built after the fix is pushed, and I see the same problem after about 2 days. I think the leak is slower than before, but there is one.

[~jbreiding] I have a setup that I built March 29 (http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/3173/). This one has the leak problem. The last commit on that setup is 11ad8e29785419f0ee3dc9e6a50d8edd504d59fc. 

The leak was slower. It took more than 2 days for the NC get busted.

Currently the memory usage doesn't look bad at all for the NC.

{{ root     18119  0.0  0.0  56556  1508 ?        Ss   14:14   0:00 /usr/sbin/httpd -f //var/run/eucalyptus/httpd-nc.conf
500      18127  1.2  2.3 3345848 192648 ?      Sl   14:14   0:03 /usr/sbin/httpd -f //var/run/eucalyptus/httpd-nc.conf
500      18525  0.0  1.4 3256916 112776 ?      S    14:15   0:00 /usr/sbin/httpd -f //var/run/eucalyptus/httpd-nc.conf
500      18527  0.0  1.5 3256920 123136 ?      S    14:15   0:00 /usr/sbin/httpd -f //var/run/eucalyptus/httpd-nc.conf
500      18528  0.0  1.5 3256920 123184 ?      S    14:15   0:00 /usr/sbin/httpd -f //var/run/eucalyptus/httpd-nc.conf }}
[~jbreiding] I restarted the daemon about 15 minutes ago.

Any chance your testing routines can be run against an NC w/o support for ENI attach/detach?

I will dig a little further next week into getting valgrind running again.

This manifests consistently in QA (in VPC mode at least). 

12 hours after the QA finishes, this is the memory footprint of NC:
 4409 eucalypt  20   0 10.0g 3.5g 6444 S 19.9 46.1  46:00.57 /usr/sbin/httpd -f //var/run/eucalyptus/httpd-nc.conf                             
 4321 root      20   0 56556  900  736 S  0.0  0.0   0:00.70 /usr/sbin/httpd -f //var/run/eucalyptus/httpd-nc.conf                             
 4506 eucalypt  20   0 3097m  89m  528 S  0.0  1.1   0:00.07 /usr/sbin/httpd -f //var/run/eucalyptus/httpd-nc.conf                             
 4536 eucalypt  20   0 3097m  99m  708 S  0.0  1.3   0:00.70 /usr/sbin/httpd -f //var/run/eucalyptus/httpd-nc.conf                             
 4537 eucalypt  20   0 3097m  89m  632 S  0.0  1.1   0:37.61 /usr/sbin/httpd -f //var/run/eucalyptus/httpd-nc.conf

Two things I discovered during investigation:
* Memory usage is proportional to the number of VMs.
* Memory usage is independent of API calls from CC (usage increases when CC's stopped). 
So this likely indicates that the leak is happening in one of the bookeeping threads (sensors, libivirt, etc).

The leak is happening in the call "xmlSaveFormatFileEnc" from write_xml_file:
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/blob/master/node/xml.c#L364

This looks like a leakage in libxml2, but the fact that it manifests only in vpc mode indicates that it is triggered by what we write in xml doc.
Larger number of instances caused faster memory leakage.
[~tony], would testing this involve running top (or vmstat) while running and shutting down instances to see that memory returns back to where it started (over a few cycles)?

[~dkavanagh] In general, if the Cloud is up&running a few days, that verifies this. For short-term verification, you can see if there's any changes in  cat /proc/[PROC]/status | grep VmRSS  where the proc number is the NC's httpd. The original issue manifested when there are instances running in VPC (you don't need to run/terminate instances). VmRSS kept increasing every minute or so. It manifests only in VPC.

sooooo, if the shared setup 1 is still running, we're good here? :-)
no, I'll go check /proc/PROC/status...

Verified one NC on shared setup 1, region two (vpc) has been up since Wednesday:
Redirecting to /bin/systemctl status  eucalyptus-nc.service
● eucalyptus-node.service - Eucalyptus node controller
   Loaded: loaded (/usr/lib/systemd/system/eucalyptus-node.service; enabled; vendor preset: disabled)
   Active: active (running) since Wed 2016-06-22 11:32:25 PDT; 2 days ago

For this process:
root      3053     1  0 Jun22 ?        00:00:04 /usr/sbin/httpd -f //run/eucalyptus/httpd-nc.conf -DFOREGROUND

I ran:
[root@g-08-09 ~]# while true; do cat /proc/3053/status |grep VmRSS; sleep 60; done
VmRSS:	    2764 kB
VmRSS:	    2764 kB
VmRSS:	    2764 kB
VmRSS:	    2764 kB
VmRSS:	    2764 kB
VmRSS:	    2764 kB
VmRSS:	    2764 kB
VmRSS:	    2764 kB
VmRSS:	    2764 kB
VmRSS:	    2764 kB
Not seeing any increase, good to go.
